channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lack of warning markers, 6th June
item.description:
Markers warning of deep ditch beside lane missing and ditch hidden by plants growing on road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Lane, not A417, 6th June
item.description:
Soil on lane, narrows lane c.1m Also verge side vegetation is growing across road. This is a verge adopted by Highways following land take for the Brockworth bypass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Rough road surface no road sign, 6th June
item.description:

item.title: White lines on roundabout, 6th June
item.description:
Although new cycle lanes have been installed there are no white lines separating lanes. Vehicles frequently are cutting across other vehicles. While waiting to enter the roundabout it is impossible to tell whether vehicles are proceeding around the roundabout or leaving at an exit. This causes tailbacks on the A46 and A417 slip roads
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Dumping Ground, 6th June
item.description:
The rubbish is piling up again outside no 22, it seems the most of it comes from the Guinness Partnership buildings, could the council address this properly please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Lansdown Crescent, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing white lines, 6th June
item.description:
White lines are very patchy up Birdlip Hill. Frequently vehicles traveling down the hill are well across where the white line should be. Not helped by narrow road and encroaching hedges/trees
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Flytipped mattress Malthouse Lane, 6th June
item.description:
Mattress Flytipped on pavement outside 49a St Paul’s Road (entrance on Malthouse Lane)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, St Paul's Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Soil and plants on pavement, 6th June
item.description:
Soil and subsequently plants now covering pavement. This pavement extends to the narrowing of the three lane stretch by Crickley Court. Has not been cleared for several years. Although there are three lanes at this point van used by workers on A417 park here. The road is also a busy road used by residents, cyclists, walkers and horse riders.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
